title.narrative: APSM TLO / Salah Raising Afghan people’s voice 2019-2020
APSM TLO / Salah Stöd till afghanska röster för fred 2019-2020

description.narrative: Stöd till SALAH Consortium, under ledning av TLO, för genomförande av ett projekt på provinsiell nivå till stöd för inkluderande fred och påverkansarbete relaterat till den afghanska fredsprocessen.
Support to the SALAH Consortium, led by TLO, for the implementation of a project at the provincial level in support of inclusive peace and advocay work related to the Afghan peace process.

The overarching objective the project is that people’s voices is strengthened in the Afghan peace process. The project also aimed to reach the following two outcomes: 1. Local voices are increasingly mainstreamed in Afghanistan’s national peace discourse; and policy makers and decision makers are informed of these voices by having access to local peace perceptions via town halls and position papers. 2. Exchange on peace issues between the national and local level happens more regularly; and collective public voice is effectively coordinated through the CSO and Media Secretariat.

description.narrative: Salah Consortium's project has contributed to exchanges on peace issues between the national and local level by setting up peace secretariats in seven provinces with the purpose to serve as structures that can continuously promote local peace messages to the national level as well as disseminate national messages to provincial and local levels and by conducting a series of 24 townhall meetings across 9 provinces. There now exist 7 provincial peace secretariats across Kabul, Balkh, Bamyan, Kandahar, Herat, Paktia, Nangarhar and Kunduz, which have around 25 members in each, out of which 8-10 are women. Through the peace secretariats, the Salah partners (TLO, SDO, AWEC, PTRO and EPD) have conducted a series of capacity-building workshops for all provincial peace secretariat members which have contributed to increasing capacity for local media and civil society members to undertake advocacy efforts and coordinate peace-building activities in their communities. After having conducted the townhall meetings with local communities, the secretariat members have disseminated the local messages to the national level through a total of 52 television and radio programmes during the course of the project. The secretariats have also become a platform for CSOs and Media actors to coordinate their work and plan joint advocacy efforts. The townhall symposiums have increased the engagement of both CSOs and constituents of the population (women, men, girls, and boys) in peace debates and the national level peace process across ethnic groups, sectors, and segments of the population, which has contributed to peace-building and increased social cohesion within and between the communities involved. Data from these symposiums have been collected by the partners and analysed and generated into three policy papers and three position papers reflecting the shared and diverging differences between the constituencies engaged in the different symposiums across of Afghanistan. These reports have been shared with policy-makers and launched together with national media outlets to mainstream local voices in the national peace discourse for it to better reflect the concerns and needs of the population.
